preface.title: About this document
preface.p: This document is a step-by-step guide for Cucumber, a tool that is quickly becoming the weapon of choice for many agile teams when it comes to functional test automation, creating executable specifications and building a living documentation. We believe in iterative development so we write iteratively and this is just the start:

ul.li: This version covers the basics of setting up Cucumber for Ruby, Java and .NET and how to write and design good tests.
The second version will cover integration with web test automation frameworks.
The third version will have more examples on Ajax and cover advanced web automation topics.

section.title: Online
section.p: To get notified when we publish an update, grab the code for the examples we used in the guide, provide feedback or ask a question, do one or more of the following:

Follow @davedf and @gojkoadzic on Twitter to keep in touch with the authors or drop us a message there
